general.content: The Julian Calendar becomes the calendar used in Rome

america.content: The first American flag is hoisted by George Washington

war.content: American Revolutionary War: Continental Army members rebel in the Pennsylvania Line Mutiny

general.content: Soviet spacecraft Luna 1 is launched

america.content: Georgia ratifies the Constitution

war.content: World War II: Manila is captured by Japanese forces

general.content: The Japanese Tokugawa shogunate is abolished

america.content: Alaska becomes the 49th US state

war.content: American Revolutionary War: American forces defeat British forces at the Battle of Princeton

general.content: The Soviet Luna 1 spacecraft become the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon.

america.content: Utah becomes the 45th US state

war.content: English Civil War: King Charles I and 400 soldiers fail to arrest five members of Parliament for treason

general.content: The dwarf planet of Eris is discovered

america.content: Construction of the Golden Gate Bridge begins

war.content: The party that would later become the German Nazi Party is founded in Munich

general.content: Geophysicist Alfred Wegener presents his theory of continental drift.

america.content: The Washington National Cathedral is chartered by Congress.

war.content: Vietnam War: American-South Vietnamese Operation Deckhouse Five is launched

general.content: Julius Caesar is declared a public enemy by the Roman Senate

america.content: Fire destroys the first permanent English American colony of Jamestown, Virginia

war.content: France takes control of England, the final time it would be controlled by a power located on the European mainland

general.content: The first book written in the Lithuanian language is published

america.content: George Washington delivers the first State of the Union address

war.content: Philippine Commonwealth troops attack invading Japanese troops

general.content: Steve Jobs announces the original iPhone at a Macworld keynote

america.content: Connecticut ratifies the Constitution, becoming the fifth state to do so.

war.content: The Treaty of Jassy is signed, ending the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92

general.content: The world's oldest underground railway opens, marking the beginning of the London Underground

america.content: John D. Rockefeller incorporates Standard Oil

war.content: Stephen III of Moldavia defeats the Ottoman Empire at the Battle of Vaslui

general.content: The first death from COVID-19 is recorded

america.content: Grand Canyon National Monument is created

war.content: The Anglo-Zulu War begins

general.content: The University of Calcutta becomes the first university in South Asia

america.content: Apple Computer starts selling the Macintosh personal computer

war.content: Second Boer War: Boers stop a British attempt to break the Siege of Ladysmith

general.content: Angolan capital Luanda is founded by the Portuguese

america.content: The company that would later become Nike is founded by athletes at the University of Oregon

war.content: World War II: Thailand declares war on the United States and United Kingdom

general.content: The world's largest diamond, weighing nearly 3,107 carats, is found near Pretoria, South Africa

america.content: The Apollo theater reopens in the Harlem neighborhood of New York City

war.content: Troops loyal to The Mahdi conquer Khartoum, killing the Governor-General Charles George Gordon.

general.content: Apple announces the iPad

america.content: Cold War: The Soviet Union, United States, and United Kingdom sign the Outer Space Treaty, banning deployment of nuclear weapons in space.

war.content: Tokugawa rebels establish the Ezo Republic in Hokkaido

general.content: LEGO patents the design of its bricks, which are compatible with ones made today.

america.content: The United States Coast Guard is established

war.content: Finnish Civil War: the Red Guard rebels seize the capital Helsinki

general.content: Karl Benz patents the first successful gasoline-powered car

america.content: Charles Curtis of Kansas becomes the first Native American Senator

war.content: Crimean War: Queen Victoria establishes the Victoria cross award for acts of velour for British military personnel

general.content: Japanese carmaker Mazda is founded as a cork manufacturer

america.content: Yerba Buena is renamed to become San Francisco, California

war.content: The truce of Andrusovo is signed, ending the Russia-Polish War of 1654-1667

general.content: During the Gunpowder Plot, Guy Fawkes is executed for treason

america.content: The Saturn V rocket used in Apollo 14 is launched, carrying Alan Shepard, Stuart Roosa, and Edgar Mitchell to the Moon

war.content: Robert E. Lee becomes the general-in-chief of all Confederate armies

general.content: Thomas Edison finishes construction of the first motion picture studio, the Black Maria, in West Orange, New Jersey

america.content: President Abraham Lincoln signs the Thirteenth Amendment.

war.content: French Revolutionary Wars: France declares war on the United Kingdom and the Netherlands

birth.content: Harry Styles, English singer-songwriter and actor

general.content: Queen Victoria's Funeral is held.

america.content: Various cities agree to form an American baseball league

war.content: Mexican–American War: The Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo is signed.

general.content: Massachusetts issues the first paper money in the Americas

america.content: The Fifteenth Amendment to the US Constitution is ratified

war.content: Adolf Hitler announces that the expansion of Lebensraum is ultimate geopolitical objective of Nazi foreign policy

general.content: The first Mormon pioneers make their exodus from Nauvoo, Illinois, westward towards Salt Lake Valley

america.content: George Washington is unanimously elected as the first President of the United States by the Electoral College

war.content: Napoleonic Wars: Britain seizes Guadeloupe

general.content: Astronauts land on the Moon in the Apollo 14 mission

america.content: United States President Donald Trump is acquitted by the United States Senate in his first impeachment trial

war.content: Peninsular War: Siege of Cádiz begins

general.content: Jack Kilby of Texas Instruments files the first patent for an integrated circuit

america.content: American Revolutionary War: The Treaty of Alliance and the Treaty of Amity and Commerce are signed, causing France to recognize the United States

war.content: The Ugandan Bush War begins

general.content: The first untethered spacewalk is made as part of the Space Shuttle program

america.content: The 11th Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified

war.content: Korean War: More than 700 suspected communist sympathizers are massacred by South Korean forces

general.content: The College of William & Mary in Williamsburg, Virginia, the second-oldest institution of higher education in the Thirteen Colonies, is granted a charter

america.content: Delaware refuses to ratify the Thirteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, delaying the criminalization of slavery until December 6, 1865.

war.content: World War II: Japan invades Singapore

general.content: The Beatles make their first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show, performing before a record-setting audience of 73 million viewers

america.content: US president Ulysses S. Grant signs a joint resolution of Congress that establishes the U.S. Weather Bureau

war.content: American Revolutionary War: The British Parliament declares Massachusetts in rebellion

general.content: IBM supercomputer Deep Blue defeats Garry Kasparov in chess for the first time

america.content: The 25th Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified

war.content: Spanish Civil War: The Nationalists conclude their conquest of Catalonia and seal the border with France

general.content: The Beatles record their first album Please Please Me

america.content: First session of United States Senate opens to the public

war.content: American Civil War: The United States House of Representatives unanimously passes a resolution guaranteeing noninterference with slavery in any state

general.content: The Soviet Union launches Venera 1 towards Venus

america.content: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) is founded

war.content: Cold War: During the 1988 Black Sea bumping incident, The USS Yorktown is intentionally rammed by the Soviet frigate Bezzavetnyy in Soviet territorial waters

general.content: Thomas Edison observes Thermionic emission

america.content: For the first time in more than 100 years the Umatilla tribe are able to hunt and harvest a bison just outside Yellowstone National Park, restoring a centuries-old tradition

war.content: Siege of Baghdad: Hulegu Khan, a prince of the Mongol Empire, orders his army to sack and plunder the city of Baghdad

general.content: James Cook is killed by Native Hawaiians near Kealakekua on the Island of Hawaii

america.content: In New York City, James Polk becomes the first serving President of the United States to have his photograph taken

war.content: American Revolutionary War: The Battle of Kettle Creek is fought in Georgia

general.content: Stevens Institute of Technology is founded in New Jersey, US, and offers the first Bachelor of Engineering degree in mechanical engineering

america.content: Canada and the United States agree to construct the Distant Early Warning Line, a system of radar stations in the far northern Arctic regions of Canada and Alaska

war.content: The battleship USS Maine explodes and sinks in Havana harbor in Cuba, killing about 274 of the ship's roughly 354 crew.

general.content: Iceland's first football club, Knattspyrnufélag Reykjavíkur, is founded

america.content: The submarine USS Triton begins Operation Sandblast, the first submerged circumnavigation of the globe

war.content: First English Civil War: Battle of Torrington, Devon is held, the last major battle

general.content: NASA's Discovery Program begins as the NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft lifts off on the first mission ever to orbit and land on an asteroid, 433 Eros

america.content: The United States House of Representatives pass the Missouri Compromise

war.content: The Battle of Vasai commences as the Marathas move to invade Portuguese-occupied territory

general.content: Mark Twain's book Adventures of Huckleberry Finn is published in the United States

america.content: Richard Petty wins a then-record sixth Daytona 500, the first NASCAR race televised live flag-to-flag

war.content: Napoleonic Wars: The Battle of Montereau

general.content: Thomas Edison patents the phonograph

america.content: Former Vice President Aaron Burr is arrested for treason in Wakefield, Alabama, and confined to Fort Stoddert

war.content: The Second Battle of Guararapes takes place, effectively ending Dutch colonization efforts in Brazil

general.content: William Buckland formally announces the name Megalosaurus, the first scientifically validly named non-avian dinosaur species

america.content: The US Post Office Department, is created by United States President George Washington

war.content: Adolf Hitler secretly meets with German industrialists to arrange for financing of an upcoming election campaign for the Nazi Party

general.content: The first self-propelling steam locomotive makes its outing at the Pen-y-Darren Ironworks in Wales

america.content: The newly completed Washington Monument is dedicated

war.content: Finnish War: Without a previous declaration of war, Russian troops cross the border to Sweden at Abborfors in eastern Finland, staring the war

general.content: Saint Lucia gains independence from the United Kingdom

america.content: President Grover Cleveland signs a bill admitting North Dakota, South Dakota, Montana and Washington as U.S. states

war.content: The French Revolution of 1848, which would lead to the establishment of the French Second Republic, begins

general.content: The first mass inoculation of children against polio with the Salk vaccine begins in Pittsburgh

america.content: Alabama becomes the first U.S. state to enact an anti-trust law

war.content: Texas Revolution: The Siege of the Alamo (prelude to the Battle of the Alamo) begins in San Antonio, Texas

general.content: Japan launches its fourth spy satellite

america.content: Andrew Johnson becomes the first President to be impeached by the House of Representatives.

war.content: World War I: The U.S. ambassador to the United Kingdom, Walter Hines Page, is given the Zimmermann Telegram.

general.content: Four thousand defenders of Pilenai commit mass suicide rather than be taken captive by the Teutonic Knights

america.content: Launch of the USS Ranger, the first purpose-built aircraft carrier to be commissioned by the US Navy.

war.content: Adolf Hitler, having been stateless for seven years, obtains German citizenship when he is appointed a Brunswick state official by Dietrich Klagges, a fellow Nazi.

general.content: Napoleon Bonaparte escapes from exile on the island of Elba

america.content: The Beach Pneumatic Transit in New York City, intending as a demonstration for a subway line, opens

war.content: Japan and Korea sign the Treaty of Kangwha, which ends Korea's status as a tributary state of China

general.content: The Government of Italy ask for help to keep the Leaning Tower of Pisa from toppling over

america.content: Gulf War: George H. W. Bush announces that "Kuwait is liberated"

war.content: American Civil War: The first Northern prisoners arrive at the Confederate prison in Andersonville, Georgia

general.content: Space Shuttle Atlantis is launched on STS-36

america.content: American spy satellite Discoverer 1, the first object intended to achieve a polar orbit, is launched but fails to achieve orbit

war.content: A Turkish military memorandum resulted in the collapse of the coalition government in Turkey

general.content: The United States and the Taliban sign the Doha Agreement for bringing peace to Afghanistan

america.content: In a ceremony held in Berkeley, California, physicist Ernest Lawrence receives the 1939 Nobel Prize in Physics

war.content: Finland initiates Winter War peace negotiations

general.content: Aviator Charles Lindbergh's 20-month-old son Charles Jr is kidnapped from his home in East Amwell, New Jersey.

america.content: U.S. President John Tyler signs a bill authorizing the annexation of the Republic of Texas

war.content: Publius Valerius Publicola celebrates the first triumph of the Roman Republic after his victory over the deposed king Lucius Tarquinius Superbus at the Battle of Silva Arsia

general.content: The Bank of England issues the first one-pound and two-pound banknotes.

america.content: The Republic of Texas declares its independence from Mexico

war.content: American Revolutionary War: Patriot militia units attempt to prevent capture of supply ships in and around the Savannah River by a small fleet of the Royal Navy in the Battle of the Rice Boats.

birth.content: Lou Reed, American singer-songwriter, guitarist, producer, and actor

general.content: Alexander II of Russia signs the Emancipation Manifesto, freeing serfs.

america.content: Shoshone National Forest is established as the first national forest in the US and world.

war.content: American Revolutionary War: The first amphibious landing of the United States Marine Corps begins the Battle of Nassau

birth.content: Khaltmaagiin Battulga, Mongolian politician and wrestler, 5th President of Mongolia

general.content: Frances Perkins became the first woman appointed to the U.S. Cabinet.

america.content: The city of Chicago is incorporated.

war.content: World War II: The United Kingdom launches Operation Claymore on the Lofoten Islands; the first large scale British Commando raid.

general.content: Joseph Stalin, the longest serving leader of the Soviet Union, dies after suffering a cerebral hemorrhage four days earlier.

america.content: Boston Massacre: Five Americans, including Crispus Attucks, are fatally shot by British troops

war.content: Cold War: Winston Churchill coins the phrase "Iron Curtain" in his speech at Westminster College, Missouri.

general.content: Great Depression: President Franklin D. Roosevelt declares a bank holiday, closing all U.S. banks and freezing all financial transactions.

america.content: The Missouri Compromise is signed into law by President James Monroe.

war.content: Italo-Turkish War: Italian forces become the first to use airships in war, as two dirigibles drop bombs on Turkish troops encamped at Janzur from an altitude of 1,800 m.

general.content: Marcus Aurelius and L. Commodus (who changes his name to Lucius Verus) become joint emperors of Rome on the death of Antoninus Pius

america.content: Bloody Sunday: A group of 600 civil rights marchers are brutally attacked by state and local police in Selma, Alabama

war.content: A peace treaty is signed between the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of Venice, ending the Ottoman–Venetian War and leaving Cyprus in Ottoman hands.

general.content: French aviator Raymonde de Laroche becomes the first woman to receive a pilot's license

america.content: The United States Senate votes to limit filibusters by adopting the cloture rule

war.content: Vietnam War: US Marines arrive at Da Nang.

general.content: The first documented discovery of gold in California occurs at Rancho San Francisco, six years before the California Gold Rush.

america.content: The U.S. Supreme Court rules that captive Africans who had seized control of the ship carrying them had been taken into slavery illegally

war.content: Mexican Revolution: Pancho Villa leads nearly 500 Mexican raiders in an attack against the border town of Columbus, New Mexico.

general.content: The first successful test of a telephone is made by Alexander Graham Bell.

america.content: The Long Beach earthquake affects the Greater Los Angeles Area, leaving around 108 people dead.

war.content: First Punic War: Battle of the Aegates: The Romans sink the Carthaginian fleet bringing the First Punic War to an end.

general.content: The World Health Organization (WHO) declares the COVID-19 pandemic.

america.content: In New York City, Samuel Roxy Rothafel opens the Roxy Theatre.

war.content: World War II: United States President Franklin Roosevelt signs the Lend-Lease Act into law, allowing American-built war supplies to be shipped to Allies on loan.

general.content: Sir Tim Berners-Lee submits his proposal to CERN for an information management system, which subsequently develops into the World Wide Web.

america.content: The Girl Guides (later renamed the Girl Scouts of the USA) are founded.

war.content: Cold War: In an attempt to stop the spread of communism, the Truman Doctrine is proclaimed.

general.content: William Herschel discovers Uranus.

america.content: Harvard College is named after clergyman John Harvard.

war.content: The Winter War between Finland and the Soviet Union officially ends after the signing of the Moscow Peace Treaty

general.content: A naming ceremony for the chemical element nihonium takes place in Tokyo, with then Crown Prince Naruhito in attendance.

america.content: Jack Ruby is convicted of killing Lee Harvey Oswald, the assumed assassin of John F. Kennedy.

war.content: Korean War: United Nations troops recapture Seoul for the second time.

general.content: President Lyndon B. Johnson, responding to the Selma crisis, tells U.S. Congress "We shall overcome" while advocating the Voting Rights Act.

america.content: Maine is admitted as the twenty-third U.S. state.

war.content: Start of the Anglo-Tibetan War of 1888.

general.content: The Dow Jones Industrial Average falls by 2,997.10, the single largest point drop in history and the second-largest percentage drop ever at 12.93%, an even greater crash than Black Monday.

america.content: The Army Corps of Engineers is established to found and operate the United States Military Academy at West Point

war.content: The Dutch bombard Givet during the Nine Years' War.

general.content: The United States launches the first solar-powered satellite, which is also the first satellite to achieve a long-term orbit.

america.content: American Revolution: The British Army evacuates Boston, ending the Siege of Boston, after George Washington and Henry Knox place artillery in positions overlooking the city

war.content: In his last victory, Julius Caesar defeats the Pompeian forces of Titus Labienus and Pompey the Younger in the Battle of Munda

general.content: Cosmonaut Alexei Leonov, leaving his spacecraft Voskhod 2 for 12 minutes, becomes the first person to walk in space

america.content: Congress repeals the requirement for a gold reserve to back US currency

war.content: American Revolution: The British Parliament repeals the Stamp Act

general.content: The US Congress establishes time zones and approves daylight saving time

america.content: In the first documented bank heist in U.S. history, burglars stole $245,000 from the City Bank on Wall Street. Most of the money was recovered

war.content: A Mongol victory at the Battle of Yamen ends the Chinese opSong dynasty

general.content: Albert Einstein submits his "The Foundation of the General Theory of Relativity", paper to the journal Annalen der Physik, establishing his general theory of relativity.

america.content: Harriet Beecher Stowe's Uncle Tom's Cabin is published

war.content: Iraq War: The United States, the United Kingdom, Australia, and Poland begin an invasion of Iraq

general.content: Martin Luther King Jr. leads 3,200 people on the start of the third and finally successful civil rights march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama

america.content: The first Earth Day proclamation is issued by Joseph Alioto, Mayor of San Francisco

war.content: American President Jimmy Carter announces a United States boycott of the 1980 Summer Olympics in Moscow to protest the Soviet–Afghan War

general.content: The Beatles release their debut album Please Please Me.

america.content: The Intel Corporation ships the first Pentium chips (80586), featuring a 60 MHz clock speed, 100+ MIPS, and a 64 bit data path

war.content: Nazi Germany opens its first concentration camp, Dachau

general.content: A container ship runs aground and obstructs the Suez Canal for six days

america.content: NASA launches Gemini 3, the United States' first two-man space flight

war.content: American Revolutionary War: Patrick Henry delivers his  "Give me liberty, or give me death!" speech at St. John's Episcopal Church, Richmond, Virginia

general.content: The 1921 Women's Olympiad began in Monte Carlo, becoming the first international women's sports event.

america.content: During the colonial period, the Quartering Act is passed, requiring the Thirteen Colonies to house British troops

war.content: Turco-Mongol emperor Timur sacks Damascus

general.content: Titan, the largest moon of Saturn, is discovered by Christiaan Huygens

america.content: Civil rights activists led by Martin Luther King Jr. successfully complete their 4-day 50-mile (80 km) march from Selma to the capitol in Montgomery, Alabama.

war.content: Following the completion of the Afrin offensive in the Syrian civil war, Syrian Democratic Forces initiate an insurgency against Turkish occupation in the Afrin District

general.content: The Islam holiday of Eid al-Fitr is initially celebrated

america.content: The Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore collapses after the MV Dali collides with it.

war.content: World War II: The Battle of Iwo Jima ends as the island is officially secured by American forces.

general.content: The most powerful earthquake recorded in North American history strikes Alaska, killing 125.

america.content: The US Navy is established

war.content: The Battle of Taierzhuang begins in the Second Sino-Japanese War. This battle becomes the first major Chinese victory in the war.

general.content: A partial meltdown occurs at the Three Mile Island nuclear plant.

america.content: During the American Civil War battle of Glorieta Pass, Union forces stop a Confederate invasion of the New Mexico Territory

war.content: The Battle of Waireka begins in the First Taranaki War of New Zealand.

general.content: The Terracotta Army is discovered in the Shaanxi province of China

america.content: Mariner 10 becomes the first space probe to fly by Mercury

war.content: In the Battle of Kambula during the Anglo-Zulu War, 20,000 Zulus are defeated by British forces

general.content: SpaceX reuses an orbital-class rocket for the first time in history.

america.content: William H. Seward purchases Alaska from Russia for $7.2 million

war.content: The Easter Offensive of the Vietnam War begins after North Vietnamese forces cross into the Demilitarized Zone of South Vietnam

general.content: The Eiffel Tower opens

america.content: Daylight saving time goes into effect in the US for the first time

war.content: Japanese forces invade the British Christmas Island

general.content: Singapore becomes a British crown colony

america.content: In New York City, the United States House of Representatives achieves its first quorum and elects Frederick Muhlenberg of Pennsylvania as its first Speaker

war.content: In the Eighty Years' War, the Watergeuzen capture Brielle from the Seventeen Provinces, gaining the first foothold on land for what would become the Dutch Republic

general.content: Ludwig van Beethoven leads the premiere of his First Symphony in Vienna

america.content: Having spotted land on March 27, Spanish explorer Juan Ponce de León comes ashore on what is now the U.S. state of Florida, landing somewhere between the modern city of St. Augustine and the mouth of the St. Johns River

war.content: American entry into World War I: President Wilson asks the U.S. Congress for a declaration of war on Germany

general.content: Apple Inc. released the first generation iPad, a tablet computer

america.content: The first successful United States Pony Express run from St. Joseph, Missouri, to Sacramento, California, begins

war.content: American Civil War: Union forces capture Richmond, Virginia, the capital of the Confederate States of America

general.content: Space Shuttle program: Space Shuttle Challenger makes its maiden voyage into space on STS-6

america.content: William Henry Harrison dies of pneumonia, becoming the first President of the United States to die in office, and setting the record for the briefest administration. Vice President John Tyler succeeds Harrison as President

war.content: King Louis the Pious captures Barcelona from the Moors after a siege of several months

general.content: In Japan, the Akashi Kaikyō Bridge opens to traffic, becoming the longest bridge span in the world

america.content: In Virginia, Native American Pocahontas marries English colonist John Rolfe

war.content: American Civil War: The Battle of Yorktown begins

general.content: In Athens, the opening of the first modern Olympic Games is celebrated, 1,500 years after the original games are banned by Roman emperor Theodosius I

america.content: The American League of Major League Baseball begins using the designated hitter

war.content: Julius Caesar defeats Caecilius Metellus Scipio and Marcus Porcius Cato (Cato the Younger) at the Battle of Thapsus

general.content: The National Football League makes helmets mandatory

america.content: Booker T. Washington becomes the first African American to be depicted on a United States postage stamp

war.content: End of Burmese–Siamese War (1765–1767)

general.content: Auguste Deter, the first person to be diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease, dies

america.content: Harvard University votes to establish the Harvard Business School

war.content: World War II: After an air raid accidentally destroys a train carrying about 4,000 Nazi concentration camp internees in Prussian Hanover, the survivors are massacred by Nazis

general.content: The first Boeing 737 (a 100 series) makes its maiden flight

america.content: The United States Atomic Energy Commission is formed

war.content: Battle of Liegnitz: Mongol forces defeat the Polish and German armies

general.content: Bach leads the first performance of his cantata Erfreut euch, ihr Herzen, BWV 66, his first cantata composed for Easter in Leipzig

america.content: The first Arbor Day is celebrated in Nebraska

war.content: Napoleonic Wars: The War of the Fifth Coalition begins when forces of the Austrian Empire invade Bavaria

general.content: The Apple I is created

america.content: US President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Civil Rights Act of 1968, prohibiting discrimination in the sale, rental, and financing of housing

war.content: World War II: American forces liberate the Buchenwald concentration camp

general.content: The polio vaccine, developed by Dr. Jonas Salk, is declared safe and effective

america.content: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt dies in office; Vice President Harry S. Truman becomes President upon Roosevelt's death.

war.content: American Civil War: Mobile, Alabama, falls to the Union Army

general.content: Tiger Woods becomes the youngest golfer to win the Masters Tournament

america.content: The United States launches Transit 1-B, the world's first satellite navigation system

war.content: American Civil War: Union forces surrender Fort Sumter to Confederate forces

general.content: The world's fair Exposition Universelle opens in Paris

america.content: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is shot in Ford's Theatre by John Wilkes Booth; Lincoln dies the following day

war.content: Thirty Years' War: Forces of the Holy Roman Empire and Electorate of Saxony are defeated by the Swedes at the Battle of Chemnitz, ending the military effectiveness of the Saxon army for the rest of the war and allowing the Swedes to advance into Bohemia

general.content: The General Electric Company is formed

america.content: Jackie Robinson debuts for the Brooklyn Dodgers, breaking baseball's color line

war.content: President Abraham Lincoln calls for 75,000 volunteers to quell the insurrection that soon became the American Civil War

general.content: Apollo program: The launch of Apollo 16 from Cape Canaveral, Florida

america.content: The U.S. Supreme Court rules in the Baze v. Rees decision that execution by lethal injection does not violate the Eighth Amendment ban against cruel and unusual punishment

war.content: Battle of Megido – the first battle to have been recorded in what is accepted as relatively reliable detail

general.content: Trial of Martin Luther over his teachings begins during the assembly of the Diet of Worms. Initially intimidated, he asks for time to reflect before answering and is given a stay of one day

america.content: The Ellis Island immigration center processes 11,747 people, more than on any other day

war.content: Bay of Pigs Invasion: A group of Cuban exiles financed and trained by the CIA lands at the Bay of Pigs in Cuba with the aim of ousting Fidel Castro

general.content: The Republic of Ireland Act comes into force, declaring Éire to be a republic and severing Ireland's "association" with the Commonwealth of Nations

america.content: Three-Fifths Compromise: The first instance of black slaves in the United States of America being counted as three fifths of persons (for the purpose of taxation), in a resolution of the Congress of the Confederation. This was later adopted in the 1787 Constitution

war.content: American Revolution: The British advancement by sea begins; Paul Revere and other riders warn the countryside of the troop movements

general.content: The Ingenuity helicopter becomes the first aircraft to achieve flight on another planet

america.content: John Adams secures Dutch recognition of the United States as an independent government. The house which he had purchased in The Hague becomes the first American embassy

war.content: The Treaty of Frankfurt between Protestants and the Holy Roman Emperor is signed

general.content: For the first time in history, oil prices drop below zero, an effect of the 2020 Russia-Saudi Arabia oil price war

america.content: U.S. President William McKinley signs a joint resolution to Congress for declaration of war against Spain, beginning the Spanish–American War

war.content: American Civil War: Robert E. Lee resigns his commission in the United States Army in order to command the forces of the state of Virginia

general.content: Annie opens on Broadway

america.content: The American city of Flint, Michigan switches its water source to the Flint River, beginning the ongoing Flint water crisis which has caused lead poisoning in up to 12,000 people, and at least 12 deaths from Legionnaires' disease, ultimately leading to criminal indictments against 15 people, five of whom have been charged with involuntary manslaughter

war.content: The last ruler of the Lodi dynasty, Ibrahim Lodi is defeated and killed by Babur in the First Battle of Panipat

general.content: The first Earth Day is celebrated

america.content: The U.S. Congress passes the Coinage Act of 1864 that permitted the inscription In God We Trust be placed on all coins minted as United States currency

war.content: The United Kingdom, Japan and the United States sign the London Naval Treaty regulating submarine warfare and limiting shipbuilding

general.content: Coca-Cola changes its formula and releases New Coke. The response is overwhelmingly negative, and the original formula is back on the market in less than three months

america.content: The first public school in the United States, the Boston Latin School, is founded

war.content: The Siege of Santo Domingo begins during the Anglo-Spanish War, and fails seven days later

general.content: WikiLeaks starts publishing the Guantanamo Bay files leak

america.content: In the United States, the Antiterrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act of 1996 is passed into law

war.content: Nazi Germany begins its persecution of Jehovah's Witnesses by shutting down the Watch Tower Society office in Magdeburg

general.content: British and French engineers break ground for the Suez Canal

america.content: The first practical solar cell is publicly demonstrated by Bell Telephone Laboratories

war.content: The Battle of Bagrevand puts an end to an Armenian rebellion against the Abbasid Caliphate. Muslim control over the South Caucasus is solidified and its Islamization begins, while several major Armenian nakharar families lose power and their remnants flee to the Byzantine Empire

general.content: The Chernobyl disaster occurs in the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic

america.content: NASA's Ranger 4 spacecraft crashes into the Moon

war.content: Napoleon Bonaparte signs a general amnesty to allow all but about one thousand of the most notorious émigrés of the French Revolution to return to France

general.content: Betty Boothroyd becomes the first woman to be elected Speaker of the British House of Commons in its 700-year history

america.content: The U.S. Department of Justice bars Austrian President Kurt Waldheim (and his wife, Elisabeth, who had also been a Nazi) from entering the US, charging that he had aided in the deportations and executions of thousands of Jews and others as a German Army officer during World War II

war.content: First War of Scottish Independence: John Balliol's Scottish army is defeated by an English army commanded by John de Warenne, 6th Earl of Surrey at the Battle of Dunbar

general.content: Vietnam War: Boxer Muhammad Ali refuses his induction into the United States Army and is subsequently stripped of his championship and license

america.content: Billy the Kid escapes from the Lincoln County jail in Mesilla, New Mexico

war.content: The Holocaust: Nazi Germany carries out its final use of gas chambers to execute 33 Upper Austrian socialist and communist leaders in Mauthausen concentration camp

general.content: James Cook arrives in Australia at Botany Bay, which he names

america.content: The first U.S. experimental 3D television broadcast shows an episode of Space Patrol on Los Angeles ABC affiliate KECA-TV

war.content: Swedish War of Liberation: Swedish troops defeat a Danish force in the Battle of Västerås

general.content: J. J. Thomson of the Cavendish Laboratory announces his discovery of the electron as a subatomic particle, over 1,800 times smaller than a proton (in the atomic nucleus), at a lecture at the Royal Institution in London

america.content: NBC inaugurates its regularly scheduled television service in New York City, broadcasting President Franklin D. Roosevelt's N.Y. World's Fair opening day ceremonial address

war.content: The Camp Grant massacre takes place in Arizona Territory

general.content: The Empire State Building is dedicated in New York City

america.content: The Slave Trade Act 1807 takes effect, abolishing the slave trade within the British Empire.

war.content: Cold War: U-2 incident: Francis Gary Powers, in a Lockheed U-2 spyplane, is shot down over the Sverdlovsk Oblast, Soviet Union, sparking a diplomatic crisis.

general.content: President Bill Clinton announces that accurate GPS access would no longer be restricted to the United States military.

america.content: The first game of the Negro National League baseball is played in Indianapolis.

war.content: The Siege of Cuautla during the Mexican War of Independence ends with both sides claiming victory.

general.content: The first unsolicited bulk commercial email (which would later become known as "spam") is sent by a Digital Equipment Corporation marketing representative to every ARPANET address on the west coast of the United States

america.content: The sport of geocaching begins, with the first cache placed and the coordinates from a GPS posted on Usenet

war.content: New post-war Japanese constitution goes into effect

general.content: American civil rights movement: The "Freedom Riders" begin a bus trip through the South.

america.content: Rhode Island becomes the first American colony to renounce allegiance to King George III.

war.content: World War II: The German surrender at Lüneburg Heath is signed, coming into effect the following day. It encompasses all Wehrmacht units in the Netherlands, Denmark and northwest Germany

general.content: Mary Kies becomes the first woman awarded a U.S. patent, for a technique of weaving straw with silk and thread

america.content: Memorial Day first celebrated in United States at Waterloo, New York.

war.content: American Civil War: The Confederate government was declared dissolved at Washington, Georgia.

general.content: Steve Jobs of Apple Inc. unveils the first iMac.

america.content: New Deal: Under the authority of the newly-enacted Federal Emergency Relief Administration, President Franklin D. Roosevelt issues Executive Order 7034 to create the Works Progress Administration.

war.content: American Civil War: Arkansas secedes from the Union

general.content: The concept of the integrated circuit, the basis for all modern computers, is first published by Geoffrey Dummer

america.content: Space Shuttle program: The Space Shuttle Endeavour is launched on its first mission, STS-49

war.content: Indochina War: The Battle of Dien Bien Phu ends in a French defeat and a Viet Minh victory (the battle began on March 13)

general.content: Pharmacist John Pemberton first sells a carbonated beverage named "Coca-Cola" as a patent medicine.

america.content: The rollercoaster The New Revolution, the first steel coaster with a vertical loop, opens at Six Flags Magic Mountain.

war.content: Vietnam War: U.S. President Richard Nixon announces his order to place naval mines in major North Vietnamese ports in order to stem the flow of weapons and other goods to that nation.

general.content: Australia opens its first national parliament in Melbourne

america.content: Watergate scandal: The United States House Committee on the Judiciary opens formal and public impeachment hearings against President Richard Nixon

war.content: World War II: The German submarine U-110 is captured by the Royal Navy. On board is the latest Enigma machine which Allied cryptographers later use to break coded German messages.

general.content: Nelson Mandela is inaugurated as South Africa's first black president

america.content: American Revolutionary War: The Second Continental Congress takes place in Philadelphia.

war.content: American Revolutionary War: The Second Continental Congress takes place in Philadelphia.

general.content: Deep Blue, a chess-playing supercomputer, defeats Garry Kasparov in the last game of the rematch, becoming the first computer to beat a world-champion chess player in a classic match format.

america.content: Space Shuttle Atlantis is launched on the final mission to service the Hubble Space Telescope.

war.content: Indian Rebellion of 1857: Indian rebels seize Delhi from the British.

general.content: The Donner Party of pioneers departs Independence, Missouri for California, on what will become a year-long journey of hardship and cannibalism

america.content: President Roosevelt signs legislation creating the Federal Emergency Relief Administration, the predecessor of the Federal Emergency Management Agency

war.content: American Civil War: The Battle of Palmito Ranch: The first day of the last major land action to take place during the Civil War, resulting in a Confederate victory.

general.content: Large groups of students occupy Tiananmen Square and begin a hunger strike.

america.content: Mexican–American War: The United States declares war on the Federal Republic of Mexico following a dispute over the American annexation of the Republic of Texas and a Mexican military incursion.

war.content: Mary, Queen of Scots, is defeated at the Battle of Langside, part of the civil war between Queen Mary and the supporters of her son, James VI.

general.content: Skylab, the United States' first space station, is launched.

america.content: English colonists establish "James Fort," which would become Jamestown, Virginia, the earliest permanent English settlement in the Americas.

war.content: Boshin War: The Battle of Utsunomiya Castle ends as former Tokugawa shogunate forces withdraw northward

general.content: California becomes the second U.S. state after Massachusetts in 2004 to legalize same-sex marriage after the state's own Supreme Court rules a previous ban unconstitutional.

america.content: President Richard Nixon appoints Anna Mae Hays and Elizabeth P. Hoisington the first female United States Army generals

war.content: 1940 – World War II: The Battle of the Netherlands: After fierce fighting, the poorly trained and equipped Dutch troops surrender to Germany, marking the beginning of five years of occupation.

general.content: Nikola Tesla delivers a lecture describing the equipment which will allow efficient generation and use of alternating currents to transmit electric power over long distances.

america.content: The United States Congress establishes the nickel.

war.content: Imperial Russia signs the Treaty of Bucharest, ending the Russo-Turkish War. The Ottoman Empire cedes Bessarabia to Russia

general.content: The first legal same-sex marriages in the U.S. are performed in the state of Massachusetts.

america.content: The New York Stock Exchange is formed under the Buttonwood Agreement

war.content: Seven Years' War formally begins when Great Britain declares war on France

general.content: A second photo from the Hubble Space Telescope confirms that Pluto has two additional moons, Nix and Hydra.

america.content: Mount St. Helens erupts in Washington, United States, killing 57 people and causing $3 billion in damage.

war.content: Napoleonic Wars: The United Kingdom revokes the Treaty of Amiens and declares war on France.

general.content: Parks Canada, the world's first national park service, is established as the Dominion Parks Branch under the Department of the Interior.

america.content: A birthday salute to U.S. President John F. Kennedy takes place at Madison Square Garden, New York City. The highlight is Marilyn Monroe's rendition of "Happy Birthday".

war.content: Mexican–American War: Mexico ratifies the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo thus ending the war and ceding California, Nevada, Utah and parts of four other modern-day U.S. states to the United States for US$15 million.

general.content: Levi Strauss and Jacob Davis receive a U.S. patent for blue jeans with copper rivets.

america.content: Charles Lindbergh takes off for Paris from Roosevelt Field in Long Island, N.Y., aboard the Spirit of St. Louis on the first nonstop solo flight across the Atlantic Ocean, landing 33+1⁄2 hours later.

war.content: American Civil War: The state of Kentucky proclaims its neutrality, which will last until September 3 when Confederate forces enter the state. Meanwhile, the State of North Carolina secedes from the Union.

general.content: The tallest roller coaster in the world, Kingda Ka opens at Six Flags Great Adventure in Jackson Township, New Jersey.

america.content: The tallest roller coaster in the world, Kingda Ka opens at Six Flags Great Adventure in Jackson Township, New Jersey.

war.content: Falklands War: A British amphibious assault during Operation Sutton leads to the Battle of San Carlos.

general.content: Future U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is issued a patent for an invention to lift boats, making him the only U.S. president to ever hold a patent.

america.content: Apollo 10's Lunar Module flies within 8.4 nautical miles (16 km) of the Moon's surface.

war.content: Start of the Wars of the Roses: At the First Battle of St Albans, Richard, Duke of York, defeats and captures King Henry VI of England.

general.content: The first version of the Java programming language is released.

america.content: Official ratification of the Second Virginia Charter takes place.

war.content: Joan of Arc is captured at the Siege of Compiègne by troops from the Burgundian faction.

general.content: Project Mercury: American astronaut Scott Carpenter orbits the Earth three times in the Aurora 7 space capsule.

america.content: Jamestown, the first permanent English colony in North America, is founded.

war.content: The Irish Rebellion of 1798 led by the United Irishmen against British rule begins.

general.content: Star Wars (retroactively titled Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope) is released in US theaters.

america.content: Apollo program: U.S. President John F. Kennedy announces, before a special joint session of the U.S. Congress, his goal to initiate a project to put a "man on the Moon" before the end of the decade

war.content: A treaty between Pennsylvania and Maryland ends the Conojocular War with settlement of a boundary dispute and exchange of prisoners.

general.content: The European Community adopts the European flag

america.content: Montana is organized as a United States territory

war.content: The Battle of Haarlemmermeer, a naval engagement in the Eighty Years' War.

general.content: The 1,046 feet (319 m) Chrysler Building in New York City, the tallest man-made structure at the time, opens to the public

america.content: New Deal: The U.S. Federal Securities Act is signed into law requiring the registration of securities with the Federal Trade Commission

war.content: American Civil War: The first Union infantry assault of the Siege of Port Hudson occurs

general.content: Alan Turing submits On Computable Numbers for publication

america.content: U.S. President Andrew Jackson signs the Indian Removal Act which denies Native Americans their land rights and forcibly relocates them

war.content: A solar eclipse occurs, as predicted by the Greek philosopher and scientist Thales, while Alyattes is battling Cyaxares in the Battle of the Eclipse, leading to a truce. This is one of the cardinal dates from which other dates can be calculated. It is also the earliest event of which the precise date is known

general.content: Albert Einstein's theory of general relativity is tested (later confirmed) by Arthur Eddington and Andrew Claude de la Cherois Crommelin

america.content: Rhode Island becomes the last of North America's original Thirteen Colonies to ratify the Constitution and become one of the United States

war.content: American Revolutionary War: At the Waxhaws Massacre, the British continue attacking after the Continentals lay down their arms, killing 113 and critically wounding all but 53 that remained

general.content: At the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, the first Indianapolis 500 ends with Ray Harroun in his Marmon Wasp becoming the first winner of the 500-mile auto race

america.content: The Lincoln Memorial is dedicated in Washington, D.C.

war.content: Hundred Years' War: In Rouen, France, the 19-year-old Joan of Arc is burned at the stake by an English-dominated tribunal

general.content: The South Africa Act comes into force, establishing the Union of South Africa

america.content: The United States enacts its first copyright statute, the Copyright Act of 1790

war.content: World War I: Battle of Jutland: The British Grand Fleet engages the High Seas Fleet in the largest naval battle of the war, which proves indecisive

general.content: Anne Boleyn is crowned Queen of England

america.content: General Motors files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. It is the fourth largest United States bankruptcy in history

war.content: In Dover, England, Charles II of England and Louis XIV of France sign the Secret Treaty of Dover, which will force England into the Third Anglo-Dutch War

general.content: The coronation of Queen Elizabeth II at Westminster Abbey becomes the first British coronation[13] and one of the first major international events to be televised

america.content: U.S. President Calvin Coolidge signs the Indian Citizenship Act into law, granting citizenship to all Native Americans born within the territorial limits of the United States

war.content: Former Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak is sentenced to life imprisonment for his role in the killing of demonstrators during the 2011 Egyptian revolution

general.content: The launch of Gemini 4, the first multi-day space mission by a NASA crew. Ed White, a crew member, performs the first American spacewalk

america.content: American Civil War: Robert E. Lee and his Army of Northern Virginia begin marching to invade the North for a second time, starting the Gettysburg campaign

war.content: James Stuart, Duke of York (later to become King James II of England), defeats the Dutch fleet off the coast of Lowestoft

general.content: JVC introduces its VHS videotape at the Consumer Electronics Show in Chicago. It will eventually prevail against Sony's rival Betamax system in a format war to become the predominant home video medium

america.content: Major Henry C. Wayne departs New York aboard the USS Supply to procure camels to establish the U.S. Camel Corps

war.content: The Tiananmen Square protests and massacre are suppressed in Beijing by the People's Liberation Army, with between 241 and 10,000 dead (an unofficial estimate)

general.content: The first government of Singapore is sworn in

america.content: The first Great Lakes steamer, the Frontenac, is launched

war.content: The Suez Canal opens for the first time since the Six-Day War

general.content: The original Chrysler Corporation was founded by Walter Chrysler from the remains of the Maxwell Motor Company

america.content: New Deal: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt signs the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 into law, establishing the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission

war.content: Battle of Novara. In the Italian Wars, Swiss troops defeat the French under Louis II de la Trémoille, forcing them to abandon Milan; Duke Massimiliano Sforza is restored

general.content: Sony launches Betamax, the first videocassette recorder format

america.content: The United States Supreme Court overturns the conviction of Paul Cohen for disturbing the peace, setting the precedent that vulgar writing is protected under the First Amendment to the United States Constitution

war.content: Spain and Portugal sign the Treaty of Tordesillas which divides the New World between the two countries

general.content: Laki, a volcano in Iceland, begins an eight-month eruption which kills over 9,000 people and starts a seven-year famine

america.content: American Revolutionary War: Continental Army attackers are driven back at the Battle of Trois-Rivières

war.content: Vikings raid the abbey at Lindisfarne in Northumbria, commonly accepted as the beginning of Norse activity in the British Isles

general.content: The USS George Washington is launched. It is the first nuclear-powered ballistic missile submarine

america.content: U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson declares a national day of mourning following the assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy

war.content: Kosovo War: The Federal Republic of Yugoslavia and NATO sign a peace treaty

general.content: Emperor Tenji of Japan introduces a water clock (clepsydra) called Rokoku. The instrument, which measures time and indicates hours, is placed in the capital of Ōtsu

america.content: The Spirit rover is launched, beginning NASA's Mars Exploration Rover mission

war.content: World War II: Fascist Italy declares war on France and the United Kingdom, beginning an invasion of southern France

general.content: Compaq Computer pays US$9 billion for Digital Equipment Corporation in the largest high-tech acquisition

america.content: The Continental Congress appoints Thomas Jefferson, John Adams, Benjamin Franklin, Roger Sherman, and Robert R. Livingston to the Committee of Five to draft a declaration of independence

war.content: The American Revolutionary War's first naval engagement, the Battle of Machias, results in the capture of a small British naval vessel

general.content: The city of Helsinki, Finland (belonging to Sweden at the time) is founded by King Gustav I of Sweden

america.content: The United States Supreme Court in Loving v. Virginia declares all U.S. state laws which prohibit interracial marriage to be unconstitutional

war.content: Anti-apartheid activist and ANC leader Nelson Mandela is sentenced to life in prison for sabotage in South Africa

general.content: Pioneer 10 becomes the first man-made object to leave the central Solar System when it passes beyond the orbit of Neptune

america.content: Grover Cleveland notices a rough spot in his mouth and on July 1 undergoes secret, successful surgery to remove a large, cancerous portion of his jaw; the operation was not revealed to the public until 1917, nine years after the president's death

war.content: Vietnam War: The New York Times begins publication of the Pentagon Papers

general.content: Disneyland Monorail System, the first daily operating monorail system in the Western Hemisphere, opens to the public in Anaheim, California

america.content: The Second Continental Congress passes the Flag Act of 1777 adopting the Stars and Stripes as the Flag of the United States

war.content: Bear Flag Revolt begins: Anglo settlers in Sonoma, California, start a rebellion against Mexico and proclaim the California Republic

general.content: The first human blood transfusion is administered by Dr. Jean-Baptiste Denys

america.content: Margaret Jones is hanged in Boston for witchcraft in the first such execution for the Massachusetts Bay Colony

war.content: The Oregon Treaty extends the border between the United States and British North America, established by the Treaty of 1818, westward to the Pacific Ocean

general.content: The Universities Tests Act 1871 allows students to enter the universities of Oxford, Cambridge and Durham without religious tests (except for those intending to study theology)

america.content: IBM founded as the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company in Endicott, New York

war.content: American Revolutionary War: Spain declares war on the Kingdom of Great Britain, and the Great Siege of Gibraltar begins

general.content: The College Board introduces its first standardized test, the forerunner to the SAT

america.content: Watergate scandal: Five White House operatives are arrested for burgling the offices of the Democratic National Committee during an attempt by members of the administration of President Richard M. Nixon to illegally wiretap the political opposition as part of a broader campaign to subvert the democratic process

war.content: Iceland declares independence from Denmark and becomes a republic

general.content: Li Yuan becomes Emperor Gaozu of Tang, initiating three centuries of Tang dynasty rule over China

america.content: Susan B. Anthony is fined $100 for attempting to vote in the 1872 presidential election

war.content: The United States declaration of war upon the United Kingdom is signed by President James Madison, beginning the War of 1812

general.content: Garfield's first comic strip, originally published locally as Jon in 1976, goes into nationwide syndication

america.content: Congress prohibits slavery in all current and future United States territories, and President Lincoln quickly signs the legislation

war.content: The Philadelphia Eagles and Pittsburgh Steelers of the NFL merge for one season due to player shortages caused by World War II

general.content: The Wikimedia Foundation is founded in St. Petersburg, Florida

america.content: The U.S. Congress adopts the Great Seal of the United States

war.content: The Holocaust: Kazimierz Piechowski and three others, dressed as members of the SS-Totenkopfverbände, steal an SS staff car and escape from the Auschwitz concentration camp

general.content: Pluto's newly discovered moons are officially named Nix and Hydra

america.content: The United States captures Guam from Spain. The few warning shots fired by the U.S. naval vessels are misinterpreted as salutes by the Spanish garrison, which was unaware that the two nations were at war

war.content: French forces are driven out of northern Italy by Spain at the Battle of Landriano during the War of the League of Cognac

general.content: The Holy Office in Rome forces Galileo Galilei to recant his view that the Sun, not the Earth, is the center of the Universe in the form he presented it in, after heated controversy

america.content: The Pledge of Allegiance is formally adopted by U.S. Congress

war.content: Cherokee leaders Major Ridge, John Ridge, and Elias Boudinot are assassinated for signing the Treaty of New Echota, which had resulted in the Trail of Tears

general.content: IBM announces that effective January 1970 it will price its software and services separately from hardware thus creating the modern software industry

america.content: The United States Congress establishes the Government Printing Office

war.content: First War of Scottish Independence: The Battle of Bannockburn (south of Stirling) begins

general.content: First airmail service in Canada from Montreal to Toronto

america.content: In New York, capital punishment is declared unconstitutional

war.content: The Battle of Moira is fought between the High King of Ireland and the Kings of Ulster and Dál Riata. It is claimed to be the largest battle in the history of Ireland

general.content: The rainbow flag representing gay pride is flown for the first time during the San Francisco Gay Freedom Day Parade

america.content: The United States Congress passes the Mann Act, which prohibits interstate transport of women or girls for "immoral purposes"; the ambiguous language would be used to selectively prosecute people for years to come

war.content: Mozambique achieves independence from Portugal

general.content: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled, 5–4, that same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marriage under the 14th Amendment to the United States Constitution

america.content: United States President Franklin D. Roosevelt signs the Federal Credit Union Act, which establishes credit unions

war.content: Treaty of Nanking comes into effect, Hong Kong Island is ceded to the British "in perpetuity"

general.content: The first solo circumnavigation of the globe is completed by Joshua Slocum from Briar Island, Nova Scotia

america.content: U.S. president Joe Biden debates former U.S president Donald Trump. The debate leads to Biden's withdrawal from the election on July 21

war.content: The United States decides to send troops to fight in the Korean War

general.content: The first conformation dog show is held in Newcastle upon Tyne, England

america.content: The U.S. Congress passes the Spooner Act, authorizing President Theodore Roosevelt to acquire rights from Colombia for the Panama Canal

war.content: Iraq War: Sovereign power is handed to the interim government of Iraq by the Coalition Provisional Authority, ending the U.S.-led rule of that nation

general.content: Apple Inc. releases its first mobile phone, the iPhone

america.content: Hyde Park and several other Illinois townships vote to be annexed by Chicago, forming the largest United States city in area and second largest in population at the time

war.content: Korean War: U.S. President Harry S. Truman authorizes a sea blockade of Korea

general.content: The first Chevrolet Corvette rolls off the assembly line in Flint, Michigan

america.content: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln grants Yosemite Valley to California for "public use, resort and recreation".

war.content: Seven Years' War: Habsburg Austrian forces destroy a Prussian reinforcement and supply convoy in the Battle of Domstadtl, helping to expel Prussian King Frederick the Great from Moravia

general.content: The PG-13 rating is introduced by the MPAA

america.content: ZIP codes are introduced for United States mail

war.content: Ghana becomes a republic and Kwame Nkrumah becomes its first President as Queen Elizabeth II ceases to be its head of state

general.content: Thomas Savery patents the first steam engine

america.content: The first Walmart store, then known as Wal-Mart, opens for business in Rogers, Arkansas

war.content: The Continental Congress adopts the Lee Resolution severing ties with the Kingdom of Great Britain, although the wording of the formal Declaration of Independence is not adopted until July 4

general.content: Hugh Capet is crowned King of France, the first of the Capetian dynasty that would rule France until the French Revolution in 1792

america.content: Congress establishes the United States' 2nd mint in San Francisco

war.content: The final day of the Battle of Gettysburg culminates with Pickett's Charge

general.content: NASA's Pathfinder space probe lands on the surface of Mars

america.content: US Flag Act of 1818 goes into effect creating a 13 stripe flag with a star for each state. New stars would be added on July 4 after a new state had been admitted

war.content: Nazi troops massacre Polish scientists and writers in the captured Ukrainian city of Lviv

general.content: The official opening of Constantine's Bridge built over the Danube between Sucidava (Corabia, Romania) and Oescus (Gigen, Bulgaria) by the Roman architect Theophilus Patricius

america.content: Jeff Bezos founds Amazon

war.content: Portuguese forces under the command of Pedro Lopes de Sousa begin an unsuccessful invasion of the Kingdom of Kandy during the Campaign of Danture in Sri Lanka

general.content: The Late Late Show, the world's longest-running chat show by the same broadcaster, airs on RTÉ One for the first time

america.content: The Republican Party of the United States held its first convention in Jackson, Michigan

war.content: The Treaty of Edinburgh is signed by Scotland and England

general.content: Sliced bread is sold for the first time (on the inventor's 48th birthday) by the Chillicothe Baking Company of Chillicothe, Missouri

america.content: US President Ronald Reagan nominates Sandra Day O'Connor to become the first female member of the Supreme Court of the United States

war.content: The Raid of the Redeswire is the last major battle between England and Scotland

general.content: The Dow Jones Industrial Average reaches its lowest level of the Great Depression, closing at 41.22

america.content: Church bells (possibly including the Liberty Bell) are rung after John Nixon delivers the first public reading of the Declaration of Independence of the United States

war.content: The Battle of Dynekilen forces Sweden to abandon its invasion of Norway

general.content: The inaugural Wimbledon Championships begins

america.content: Daniel Hale Williams, American heart surgeon, performs the first successful open-heart surgery in United States without anesthesia

war.content: South Sudan gains independence and secedes from Sudan

general.content: Howard Hughes begins a 91-hour airplane flight around the world that will set a new record

america.content: U.S. President Millard Fillmore is sworn in, a day after becoming president upon Zachary Taylor's death

war.content: American Revolution: Louis XVI of France declares war on the Kingdom of Great Britain

general.content: Ming admiral Zheng He sets sail to explore the world for the first time

america.content: The US Navy launches the USS Nevada (BB-36) as its first standard-type battleship

war.content: The Red Army captures Mongolia from the White Army and establishes the Mongolian People's Republic

general.content: King Henry VIII of England marries his sixth and last wife, Catherine Parr, at Hampton Court Palace

america.content: The Medal of Honor is authorized by the United States Congress

war.content: The armies of Titus attack the walls of Jerusalem after a six-month siege. Three days later they breach the walls, which enables the army to destroy the Second Temple

general.content: The Dartmouth workshop is the first conference on artificial intelligence

america.content: Watergate scandal: Alexander Butterfield reveals the existence of a secret Oval Office taping system to investigators for the Senate Watergate Committee

war.content: Treaty of Berlin: The European powers redraw the map of the Balkans. Serbia, Montenegro and Romania become completely independent of the Ottoman Empire

general.content: Jane Goodall arrives at the Gombe Stream Reserve in present-day Tanzania to begin her study of chimpanzees in the wild

america.content: In Diamond, Missouri, the George Washington Carver National Monument becomes the first United States National Monument in honor of an African American

war.content: In a decree called the Gleichschaltung, Adolf Hitler abolishes all German political parties except the Nazis

general.content: The Rosetta Stone is found in the Egyptian village of Rosetta by French Captain Pierre-François Bouchard during Napoleon's Egyptian Campaign

america.content: AOL Time Warner disbands Netscape. The Mozilla Foundation is established on the same day

war.content: Napoleonic Wars: Napoleon Bonaparte surrenders aboard HMS Bellerophon
